title: Compile errors when using gcc 5.4.0
body:
Hi I followed the build instructions in the README but encountered several warning and a compile error in cramore.cpp:
g++ -pipe -std=c++0x -g -O3 -fopenmp -I. -I../htslib -I../htslib/htslib -D__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS -o cramore.o -c cramore.cpp
cramore.cpp: In function ‘int32_t runVerifyPairID(int32_t, char**)’:
cramore.cpp:719:20: warning: ISO C++ forbids converting a string constant to ‘char*’ [-Wwrite-strings]
       char* sbcd = ".";
                    ^
cramore.cpp: In function ‘int32_t runClusterMultinomEM(int32_t, char**)’:
cramore.cpp:1367:20: **error**: ‘isnan’ was not declared in this scope
  if ( isnan(llks[r]) )
                    ^
cramore.cpp:1367:20: note: suggested alternative:
In file included from /usr/include/c++/5/random:38:0,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_algo.h:66,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/algorithm:62,
                 from cramore.cpp:10:
/usr/include/c++/5/cmath:641:5: note:   ‘std::isnan’
     isnan(_Tp __x)
     ^
cramore.cpp: In function ‘int32_t runSimulContam(int32_t, char**)’:
cramore.cpp:329:28: warning: ignoring return value of ‘int sam_write1(samFile*, const bam_hdr_t*, const bam1_t*)’, declared with attribute warn_unused_result [-Wunused-result]
  sam_write1(out, header, b);
                            ^
cramore.cpp:403:28: warning: ignoring return value of ‘int sam_write1(samFile*, const bam_hdr_t*, const bam1_t*)’, declared with attribute warn_unused_result [-Wunused-result]
  sam_write1(out, header, b);   


ubuntu@ip-172-31-0-216:~/topmed_freeze3_calling$ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

ubuntu@ip-172-31-0-216:~/topmed_freeze3_calling$ uname -a
Linux ip-172-31-0-216 4.4.0-1052-aws #61-Ubuntu SMP Mon Feb 12 23:05:58 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
